member.name: T:umbraco.BusinessLogic.ApplicationBase
member.summary: ApplicationBase provides an easy to use base class to install event handlers in umbraco. Class inhiriting from ApplcationBase are automaticly registered and instantiated by umbraco on application start. To use, inhirite the ApplicationBase Class and add an empty constructor.

members.member:
A startup handler for putting the app config in the config file based on attributes found
/// TODO: This is really not a very ideal process but the code is found here because tree plugins are in the Web project or the legacy business logic project. Moving forward we can put the base tree plugin classes in the core and then this can all just be taken care of normally within the service.

member.summary: Configure a few auto-mappings

member.summary: This class is here so that we can provide lazy access to tree scanning for when it is needed

member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.

member.name: T:umbraco.businesslogic.ApplicationStartupHandler
member.summary: ApplicationStartupHandler provides an easy to use base class to install event handlers in umbraco. Class inhiriting from ApplicationStartupHandler are automaticly registered and instantiated by umbraco on application start. To use, inhirite the ApplicationStartupHandler Class and add an empty constructor.

member.name: T:umbraco.BusinessLogic.ApplicationTree
member.summary: umbraco.BusinessLogic.ApplicationTree provides access to the application tree structure in umbraco. An application tree is a collection of nodes belonging to one or more application(s). Through this class new application trees can be created, modified and deleted.

member.summary: umbraco.BasePages.BasePage is the default page type for the umbraco backend. The basepage keeps track of the current user and the page context. But does not Restrict access to the page itself. The keep the page secure, the umbracoEnsuredPage class should be used instead

member.name: T:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools
member.summary: Renders the client side code necessary to interact with the Umbraco client side API. Each method returns an instance of this class so you can chain calls together.

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.ClearClientTreeCache
member.summary: This removes all tree JSON data cached in the client browser. Useful when you want to ensure that the tree is reloaded from live data.

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.ShiftApp(System.String)
member.summary: Change applications

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.RefreshAdmin(System.Int32)
member.summary: Refresh the entire administration console after a specified amount of time.

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.RefreshTree
member.summary: Refreshes the entire current tree

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.ShowSpeechBubble(umbraco.BasePages.BasePage.speechBubbleIcon,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: A reference to the umbraco UI component "speechbubble". The speechbubble appears in the lower right corner of the screen, notifying users of events

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.ChangeContentFrameUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Changes the content in the content frame to the specified URL

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.ReloadContentFrameUrlIfPathLoaded(System.String)
member.summary: Reloads the content in the content frame if the specified URL is currently loaded

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.ShowDashboard(System.String)
member.summary: Shows the dashboard for the given application

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.ChildNodeCreated
member.summary: Reloads the children of the current action node and selects the node that didn't exist there before. If the client side system cannot determine which node is new, then no node is selected.
member.remarks: This is used by many create dialogs, however the sync method should be used based on the full path of the node but because the current Umbraco implementation of ITask only returns a url to load, there's no way to determine what the full path of the new child is.

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.SyncTree(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Synchronizes the tree to the path specified.
member.param: If set to true, will ensure that the node to be synced has it's data reloaded from the server. Otherwise, if the node already exists, the tree will simply sync to the node that is already there.
member.remarks:
This will work for any tree, however you would need to know the path of the node. Currently, media and content are the only trees that store a path, however, if you were working in the template tree for example, a path to a node could be "init,1090" and this method would still work.
Sync tree will works by syncing the active tree type. This can be specified explicitly by calling SetActiveTreeType. This will allow developers to sync many trees in one application at one time if needed.

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.ReloadActionNode(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reloads only the last node that the user interacted with via the context menu. To reload a specify node, use SyncTree.
member.remarks: If for whatever reason the client side system cannot just refresh the one node, the system will use jsTree's built in refresh tool, this however won't allow for reselect or reloadChildren. Most trees will work with the single node refresh but 3rd party tools may have poorly built tree data models.

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.SetActiveTreeType(System.String)
member.summary: When the application searches for a node, it searches for nodes in specific tree types. If SyncTree is used, it will sync the tree nodes with the active tree type, therefore if a developer wants to sync a specific tree, they can call this method to set the type to sync.
member.remarks: Each branch of a particular tree should theoretically be the same type, however, developers can override the type of each branch in their BaseTree's but this is not standard practice. If there are multiple types of branches in one tree, then only those branches that have the Active tree type will be searched for syncing.

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.CloseModalWindow(System.String)
member.summary: Closes the Umbraco dialog window if it is open
member.param: specify a value to return to add to the onCloseCallback method if one was specified in the OpenModalWindow method

member.name: M:umbraco.BasePages.ClientTools.CloseModalWindow
member.summary: Closes the umbraco dialog window if it is open

member.summary: Opens a modal window

member.summary: This will use the ScriptManager to register the script if one is available, otherwise will default to the ClientScript class of the page.

member.summary: Returns the string markup for the JavaScript that is rendered. If referencing JavaScript scripts in the backend, this class should be used in case future changes to the client code is change, this will remain intact.

member.summary: Gets/sets the app for which this page belongs to so that we can validate the current user's security against it

member.name: T:umbraco.StartsWithContainer
member.summary: Structure that checks in logarithmic time if a given string starts with one of the added keys.

member.name: F:umbraco.StartsWithContainer._list
member.summary: Internal sorted list of keys.

member.name: M:umbraco.StartsWithContainer.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified new key.

member.name: M:umbraco.StartsWithContainer.StartsWith(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the given string starts with any of the added keys.
member.returns: true if a key is found that matches the start of target
member.remarks: Runs in O(s*log(n)), with n the number of keys and s the length of target.

member.name: T:umbraco.StartsWithContainer.StartsWithComparator
member.summary: Comparator that tests if a string starts with another.
member.remarks: Not a real comparator, since it is not reflexive. (x==y does not imply y==x)

member.summary: Default string comparer.

member.summary: Gets an instance of the StartsWithComparator.

member.name: M:umbraco.StartsWithContainer.StartsWithComparator.Compare(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Tests if whole begins with all characters of part.
member.returns: Returns 0 if whole starts with part, otherwise performs standard string comparison.

member.name: T:umbraco.IO.FileMonitor

member.name: M:umbraco.IO.IOHelper.ValidateEditPath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validates if the current filepath matches a directory where the user is allowed to edit a file
member.returns: true if valid, throws a FileSecurityException if not

member.name: M:umbraco.IO.IOHelper.getRootDirectorySafe
member.summary: Returns the path to the root of the application, by getting the path to where the assembly where this method is included is present, then traversing until it's past the /bin directory. Ie. this makes it work even if the assembly is in a /bin/debug or /bin/release folder

member.name: T:umbraco.ui
member.summary: The ui class handles the multilingual text in the umbraco back-end. Provides access to language settings and language files used in the umbraco back-end.

member.name: M:umbraco.ui.Text(System.String,umbraco.BusinessLogic.User)
member.summary: Returns translated UI text with a specific key based on the specified user's language settings

member.name: M:umbraco.ui.Text(System.String)
member.summary: Returns translated UI text with a specific key based on the logged-in user's language settings

member.name: M:umbraco.ui.Text(System.String,System.String,umbraco.BusinessLogic.User)
member.summary: Returns translated UI text with a specific key and area, based on the specified users language settings

member.name: M:umbraco.ui.Text(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns translated UI text with a specific key and area, based on the logged-in users language settings

member.summary: Returns translated UI text with a specific area and key. based on the specified users language settings and variables array passed to the method

member.name: M:umbraco.ui.Text(System.String,System.String,System.String,umbraco.BusinessLogic.User)
member.summary: Returns translated UI text with a specific key and area based on the specified users language settings and single variable passed to the method

member.summary: Returns translated UI text with a specific key based on the logged-in user's language settings

member.summary: Returns translated UI text with a specific key and area based on the logged-in users language settings

member.summary: Returns translated UI text with a specific key and area based on the logged-in users language settings and variables array send to the method.

member.summary: Returns translated UI text with a specific key and area matching the variable send to the method.

member.name: M:umbraco.ui.GetText(System.String,System.String,System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Returns translated UI text with a specific key, area and language matching the variables send to the method.
member.remarks: This is the underlying call for all Text/GetText method calls

member.name: T:umbraco.UmbracoSettings

member.summary: Selects a xml node in the umbraco settings config file.
member.param: The xpath query to the specific node.
member.returns: If found, it returns the specific configuration xml node.

member.summary: Gets the value of configuration xml node with the specified key.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings._umbracoSettings
member.summary: Gets the umbraco settings document.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.UploadAllowDirectories
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the media library will create new directories in the /media directory.
member.value: true if new directories are allowed otherwise, false.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.EnableLogging
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether logging is enabled in umbracoSettings.config (/settings/logging/enableLogging).
member.value: true if logging is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.EnableAsyncLogging
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether logging happens async.
member.value: true if async logging is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.ExternalLoggerAssembly
member.summary: Gets the assembly of an external logger that can be used to store log items in 3rd party systems

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.ExternalLoggerType
member.summary: Gets the type of an external logger that can be used to store log items in 3rd party systems

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.ExternalLoggerLogAuditTrail
member.summary: Long Audit Trail to external log too

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.KeepUserLoggedIn
member.summary: Keep user alive as long as they have their browser open? Default is true

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.HideDisabledUsersInBackoffice
member.summary: Show disabled users in the tree in the Users section in the backoffice

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.AutoCleanLogs
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the logs will be auto cleaned
member.value: true if logs are to be automatically cleaned; otherwise, false

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.CleaningMiliseconds
member.summary: Gets the value indicating the log cleaning frequency (in miliseconds)

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.DisabledLogTypes
member.summary: Gets the disabled log types.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.PackageServer
member.summary: Gets the package server url.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.UseDomainPrefixes
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether umbraco will use domain prefixes.
member.value: true if umbraco will use domain prefixes; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.AddTrailingSlash
member.summary: This will add a trailing slash (/) to urls when in directory url mode NOTICE: This will always return false if Directory Urls in not active

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.UseAspNetMasterPages
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether umbraco will use ASP.NET MasterPages for rendering instead of its propriatary templating system.
member.value: true if umbraco will use ASP.NET MasterPages; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.EnableTemplateFolders
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether umbraco will attempt to load any skins to override default template files
member.value: true if umbraco will override templates with skins if present and configured false.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.NotDynamicXmlDocumentElements
member.summary: razor DynamicNode typecasting detects XML and returns DynamicXml - Root elements that won't convert to DynamicXml

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.CloneXmlCacheOnPublish
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether umbraco will clone XML cache on publish.
member.value: true if umbraco will clone XML cache on publish; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.TidyEditorContent
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether rich text editor content should be parsed by tidy.
member.value: true if content is parsed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.TidyCharEncoding
member.summary: Gets the encoding type for the tidyied content.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.PropertyContextHelpOption
member.summary: Gets the property context help option, this can either be 'text', 'icon' or 'none'

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.ForceSafeAliases
member.summary: Whether to force safe aliases (no spaces, no special characters) at businesslogic level on contenttypes and propertytypes

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.DisallowedUploadFiles
member.summary: File types that will not be allowed to be uploaded via the content/media upload control

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.ImageFileTypes
member.summary: Gets the allowed image file types.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.ScriptFileTypes
member.summary: Gets the allowed script file types.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.UmbracoLibraryCacheDuration
member.summary: Gets the duration in seconds to cache queries to umbraco library member and media methods Default is 1800 seconds (30 minutes)

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.ScriptFolderPath
member.summary: Gets the path to the scripts folder used by the script editor.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.ScriptDisableEditor
member.summary: Enabled or disable the script/code editor

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.EnsureUniqueNaming
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether umbraco will ensure unique node naming. This will ensure that nodes cannot have the same url, but will add extra characters to a url. ex: existingnodename.aspx would become existingnodename(1).aspx if a node with the same name is found
member.value: true if umbraco ensures unique node naming; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.NotificationEmailSender
member.summary: Gets the notification email sender.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.NotificationDisableHtmlEmail
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether notification-emails are HTML.
member.value: true if html notification-emails are disabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.ImageAllowedAttributes
member.summary: Gets the allowed attributes on images.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.ScheduledTasks
member.summary: Gets the scheduled tasks as XML

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.UrlReplaceCharacters
member.summary: Gets a list of characters that will be replaced when generating urls

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.RemoveDoubleDashesFromUrlReplacing
member.summary: Whether to replace double dashes from url (ie my--story----from--dash.aspx caused by multiple url replacement chars

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.UseDistributedCalls
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether umbraco will use distributed calls. This enables umbraco to share cache and content across multiple servers. Used for load-balancing high-traffic sites.
member.value: true if umbraco uses distributed calls; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.DistributedCallUser
member.summary: Gets the ID of the user with access rights to perform the distributed calls.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.PreviewBadge
member.summary: Gets the html injected into a (x)html page if Umbraco is running in preview mode

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.DistributionServers
member.summary: Gets IP or hostnames of the distribution servers. These servers will receive a call everytime content is created/deleted/removed and update their content cache accordingly, ensuring a consistent cache on all servers

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.HelpPages
member.summary: Gets HelpPage configurations. A help page configuration specify language, user type, application, application url and the target help page url.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.Repositories
member.summary: Gets all repositories registered, and returns them as XmlNodes, containing name, alias and webservice url. These repositories are used by the build-in package installer and uninstaller to install new packages and check for updates. All repositories should have a unique alias. All packages installed from a repository gets the repository alias included in the install information

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.UseViewstateMoverModule
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether umbraco will use the viewstate mover module. The viewstate mover will move all asp.net viewstate information to the bottom of the aspx page to ensure that search engines will index text instead of javascript viewstate information.
member.value: true if umbraco will use the viewstate mover module; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.isXmlContentCacheDisabled
member.summary: Tells us whether the Xml Content cache is disabled or not Default is enabled

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.XmlContentCheckForDiskChanges
member.summary: Check if there's changes to the umbraco.config xml file cache on disk on each request Makes it possible to updates environments by syncing the umbraco.config file across instances Relates to http://umbraco.codeplex.com/workitem/30722

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.EnableGlobalPreviewStorage
member.summary: If this is enabled, all Umbraco objects will generate data in the preview table (cmsPreviewXml). If disabled, only documents will generate data. This feature is useful if anyone would like to see how data looked at a given time

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.UseLegacyXmlSchema
member.summary: Whether to use the new 4.1 schema or the old legacy schema
member.value: true if yes, use the old node/data model; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.continouslyUpdateXmlDiskCache
member.summary: Tells us whether the Xml to always update disk cache, when changes are made to content Default is enabled

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.EnableSplashWhileLoading
member.summary: Tells us whether to use a splash page while umbraco is initializing content. If not, requests are queued while umbraco loads content. For very large sites (+10k nodes) it might be usefull to have a splash page Default is disabled

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.MacroErrorBehaviour
member.summary: This configuration setting defines how to handle macro errors: - Inline - Show error within macro as text (default and current Umbraco 'normal' behavior) - Silent - Suppress error and hide macro - Throw - Throw an exception and invoke the global error handler (if one is defined, if not you'll get a YSOD)
member.value: MacroErrorBehaviour enum defining how to handle macro errors.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.IconPickerBehaviour
member.summary: This configuration setting defines how to show icons in the document type editor. - ShowDuplicates - Show duplicates in files and sprites. (default and current Umbraco 'normal' behaviour) - HideSpriteDuplicates - Show files on disk and hide duplicates from the sprite - HideFileDuplicates - Show files in the sprite and hide duplicates on disk
member.value: MacroErrorBehaviour enum defining how to show icons in the document type editor.

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.DefaultDocumentTypeProperty
member.summary: Gets the default document type property used when adding new properties through the back-office
member.value: Configured text for the default document type property

member.name: P:umbraco.UmbracoSettings.SettingsFilePath
member.summary: Gets the settings file path

member.name: T:umbraco.businesslogic.Utils.JSONSerializer
member.summary:
The built in JavaScriptSerializer does not allow you to export real JavaScript objects, functions, etc... only string values which isn't always what you want. See
Override the JavaScriptSerializer serialization process and look for any custom "tags" strings such as a @ symbol which depicts that the string value should really be a JSON value, therefore the output removes the double quotes.

member.name: M:umbraco.businesslogic.Utils.JSONSerializer.ToJSONObject(System.String)
member.summary: method for a string to be converted to a json object.
member.returns: A string formatted with a special prefix
member.remarks: This essentially just prefixes the string with a special key that we will use to parse with later during serialization.

member.name: T:umbraco.BusinessLogic.Utils.SerializableData
member.summary: A generic class to inherit from or use by itself so that the serialize/deserialize methods are available to it

member.name: M:umbraco.BusinessLogic.Utils.SerializableData.Serialize(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Generic Serialization method that will serialize object without the default namespaces: http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance This also ensures that the returned XML is always encoded in UTF-8.
